18692da0-449e-42d5-aa8b-1713b749f4af.description: The earner of this badge has the skills to support effective ewe feeding and management. Application of LTEM principles increase marking rates by up to 30%, mainly through improved lamb survival and reduced ewe mortality.
18692da0-449e-42d5-aa8b-1713b749f4af.name: Lifetime Ewe Management

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: Attend a minimum of 5 face to face sessions

Observed as competent in maintaining animal welfare standards by matching the nutritional requirements with feed intake, condition scoring (CS), assessing feed on offer (FOO), feed budgeting,  metabolic energy (ME) requirements, and understanding critical welfare and production targets
Understanding of the sheep reproduction cycle and accurately assessing feed on offer (FOO)

4e81d19b-dbc6-4223-816e-3f8f84601b7d.description: The earner of this badge has successfully gained the Nationally Accredited Certificate II in Agriculture AHC20116 qualification. They have developed a wide range of skills during this practical, hands-on, work oriented training, providing operational knowledge and skills across beef, sheep, wool and dairy enterprises. Rural Industries Skill Training (RIST) RTO: TOID 4198
4e81d19b-dbc6-4223-816e-3f8f84601b7d.name: Certificate II in Agriculture AHC20116

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

alignments.name: AHC20116 Certificate II in Agriculture
alignments.description: Qualification details for AHC20116 Certificate II in Agriculture, listing all Units of Competency available under this qualification.

badge_template_activities.title: Developed fundamental knowledge and understanding of animal welfare requirements, low stress livestock handling techniques, mustering and marking.
Maintenance of basic electric and conventional farm fencing and safe work practices.
An introduction to animal nutrition, feeding out, supplementary feeding of livestock and water monitoring.
Introduction to tractor and front end loader operations, including pre and post operational checks and basic operator maintenance (available to students aged 16 and above).
Introduction to pastures, plant pest, disease and disorder identification and common weed species.  Under supervision be able to handle and apply chemicals.
If completed as an elective, develop milking skills (cattle) using appropriate equipment and understanding hygiene requirements.

Understand and follow workplace directives in oral and/or written form, identify appropriate methods of communication for the workplace with your supervisor and peers, and gain skills and knowledge when completing workplace documentation and to participate productively in meetings and discussions.

If completed as an elective, safely operate and maintain a quad bike (ATV), including loading and unloading on a trailer, safely operate in diverse types of terrain and understand relevant road rules and legislation (available to students aged 16 and above).

If completed as an elective, safely operate and maintain side-by-side utility vehicles, loading and unloading on a trailer, safely operate in diverse types of terrain and understand relevant road rules and legislation (available to students aged 16 and above).
If completed as an elective, understand the fundamentals of working in an operational shearing shed, with a focus on setting up and maintaining the shearing board and safely using the wool press.
If completed as an elective, develop handpiece usage and crutching skills and the ability to grind combs and cutters.

skills.name: Introduction To Tractor And Front End Loader Operations
Introduction To Work Health And Safety

6652eac7-d538-4620-807a-3d871ad20edf.description: The earner of this badge has successfully gained the Nationally Accredited Certificate III in Agriculture AHC30116. They have developed their skills, knowledge and understanding of agriculture through practical, work based training, underpinned by industry focused theory, tailored to suit their preferred enterprise across beef, sheep and/or dairy. Rural Industries Skill Training (RIST) RTO: TOID 4198
6652eac7-d538-4620-807a-3d871ad20edf.name: Certificate III in Agriculture AHC30116

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

alignments.name: AHC30116 Certificate III in Agriculture
alignments.description: Qualification details for AHC30116 Certificate III in Agriculture, listing all Units of Competency available under this qualification.

badge_template_activities.title: Understand their obligations to comply with relevant legislation and codes, work place procedures, application of environmentally sustainability work practices and animal welfare.
Skills and knowledge in preventative animal health treatments and implementation of health control programs.
Pro-actively monitor available pasture, determine livestock nutritional requirements, identify supplementary feeding needs and implement feed plans.
Plan, construct and maintain electric and conventional farm fencing, including tool maintenance, fence design and structure.
Undertake a workplace based project involving research and budget preparation, develop basic excel and presentation skills.

If completed as an elective, this is the industry standard for training in chemical use, storage and handling. It covers pest ID, Modes of Action, label interpretation, issues associated with chemical use, formulation types, weed and pest control application, animal health, transport and disposal, preparation and clean up, recording and other procedures.

If completed as an elective, graduates develop a strong understanding of Electronic Identification technologies, data collection capabilities and analysis techniques and how the various types of equipment and technology can be integrated into day-to-day agricultural operations.

If completed as an elective, students develop skills and knowledge specific to precision technology operations, such as drones, according to the Civil Aviation Safety Authority regulations and the responsibilities of operators and conditions of operation.

If completed as an elective, a strong understanding of the needs of newborn and young livestock is developed which includes facility preparation, feed and feed supplements, animal welfare standards and guidelines and identifying when veterinary intervention may be needed.

If completed as an elective, students are provided with a deep undertanding of the animal welfare requirements surrounding artificial insemination practices .  This includes animal preparation and nutrition pre- through to post- AI.

If completed as an elective, the requirements for preparing shearing shed facilities and equipment prior to shearing and crutching operations are covered, along with board and table workflow, how to maintain wool flow during operations and minimise contamination.

skills.name: Construction Of Electric And Convential Farm Fencing
Work Health And Safety And Environment Sustainability

f3e48bae-08a2-415d-9b6f-4d05c9f8de9e.description: The earner of this badge has the highly demonstrated skills and expertise knowledge in the sheep and wool industry to deliver the Lifetime Ewe Management (LTEM) course
f3e48bae-08a2-415d-9b6f-4d05c9f8de9e.name: Lifetime Ewe Management Trainer

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: A minimum of 5 years demonstrated experience in specifically sheep and wool industry, providing strategic on-farm advice to enhance sustainability and profitability
Demonstrated experience in delivering agriculture training in a group format with various generations, with the outcome of influencing change
Postgraduate qualification in Agriculture or Animal Science (or equivalent)
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, verbal and written. Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with people at all levels. Strong time management and organisational skills
Established strong relationships with previous, current and future participants and employers, industry bodies and networks
Ongoing liaison with industry, stakeholders and other training networks to stay up to date on industry developments and best practice for development and maintenance of course content and materials

50ecc77c-966f-43a0-80e5-972b9a8d1e3c.description: The earner of this badge has successfully gained the Nationally Accredited Certificate IV in Agriculture AHC40116. Students looking to take the next step in their agriculture career learn to context a broader agribusiness principles and practical farm management skills required to step in to a supervisory and leadership role within the industry. Rural Industries Skill Training (RIST) RTO: TOID 4198
50ecc77c-966f-43a0-80e5-972b9a8d1e3c.name: Certificate IV in Agriculture AHC40116

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

alignments.name: AHC40116 Certificate IV in Agriculture
alignments.description: Qualification details for AHC40116 Certificate IV in Agriculture, listing all Units of Competency available under this qualification.

badge_template_activities.title: Work health and safety policy and procedure as relevant to a team leader or workplace supervisor using practical, real-world case studies. Students develop skills and techniques to oversee staff, provide effective feedback, communicate work roles, coordinate activities and maintaining effective working relationships.
Condition score livestock, assess current and future pasture requirements for that mob, complete a feed budget and develop a feeding plan for the season, measure pasture and conduct feed tests.

Establish a breeding program for herd / flock, including breeding objectives, determining time frames, wool production, meat quality and structural soundness. This also includes animal welfare issues and requirements for a successful breeding program.

Goal setting, getting heifers in calf efficiently, managing pregnancy and achieving critical weights, transitioning heifers into a cow; preparing for calving and re-breeding, managing calving and analysing results.
Analyse weaner performance, manage post-weaning performance, manage ewe lambs and hoggets during joining and early pregnancy, late pregnancy, lambing and weaning.

The essential requirements for plant nutrition, how to monitor and evaluate plant growth and interpret soil test reports, determine relevant regional data and site characteristics and document soil health and plant nutrition.

bf72abe0-54af-49da-890f-c3b956c8e25c.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the Nationally Recognised Qualification, Diploma of Agriculture AHC50116. Graduates are ready to undertake a managerial position of an agricultural enterprise, taking personal responsibility and exercising autonomy in undertaking complex work. Rural Industries Skill Training (RIST) RTO: TOID 4198
bf72abe0-54af-49da-890f-c3b956c8e25c.name: Diploma of Agriculture AHC50116

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

alignments.name: AHC50116 Diploma of Agriculture
alignments.description: Qualification details for AHC50116 Diploma of Agriculture, listing all Units of Competency available under this qualification.

badge_template_activities.title: Manage staff performance using defined employment requirements, performance management practices and training programs.  Identify work health and safety priorities and implement practices throughout the organisation.  Understand personnel record management and maintenance requirements to meet legislative requirements.

Understand various types of financial reports and when they would be used relevant to the agriculture industry.  Prepare and monitor budgets using financial management systems.  Organisational accounting standards are applied for the enterprise, and reporting and audit processes in place.
Research and analyse soil characteristics and properties so to develop and implement soil amendment practices, establishing a soil management plan for the enterprise.

Confidently source information for weed, pest and disease control planning.  Determine long-term control strategies and implemented them with staff, contractors and suppliers. Identify environmental implications and risk management strategies.  Determine scheduling and key responsibilities, monitor, adjust and evaluate control strategies and record results.

Assess land resource capability and establish short and long term livestock production targets in line with business plans.  Determine nutrition requirements for livestock and the most appropriate feeding plan for each category.  Build a calendar of operations for each enterprise production cycle.  Understand legislative and regulatory requirements that are relevant to the business.  Identify and analyse an opportunity for innovation / improvement identified as a result of this analysis / plan.
Identify and develop prevention and treatment strategies for diseases relevant to the workplace and livestock, including calculating dose rates and scheduling treatments.
Identify ways to define, collate, analyse and evaluate data using statistical and analytical techniques.  Report on findings to aid decision making.

Review business goals and vision.  Prepare workforce and land usage plans.  Develop and document financial goals and risk management strategies. Identify performance requirements and measures.  Evaluate and review business performance against KPI’s.

25088653-8633-453b-89a9-fe3995772609.description: The earner of this badge has successfully gained the Nationally Accredited Certificate IV in Wool Classing AHC41316. Graduates can apply to AWEX (Australian Wool Exchange) to become a registered professional Wool Classer. Rural Industries Skill Training (RIST) RTO: TOID 4198
25088653-8633-453b-89a9-fe3995772609.name: Certificate IV in Wool Classing AHC41316

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

alignments.name: AHC41316 Certificate IV in Wool Classing
alignments.description: Qualification details for AHC41316 Certificate IV in Wool Classing, listing all Units of Competency available under this qualification.

badge_template_activities.title: Work health and safety in relation to the wool preparation workplace.
Supervise the day to day duties of a shearing team, monitor task progression and provide first point of call guidance to team members.
Carry out requirements of Code of Practice for the Preparation of Australian Wool Clips as it relates to the preparation of wool and other relevant quality standards.
Implement relevant legislative requirements associated with the shearing industry including employment agreements and awards.
Have market knowledge and know how to prepare the clip for market requirements.
Be able to prepare clips of a variety of wool types.  Implement and monitor the quality assurance processes for a clip.

15ecb4a3-635a-408c-9a4d-6a7039853698.description: The earner of this badge has learnt and demonstrated the basic fundamental skills and techniques in operating and using a manual metal arc and gas metal arc (MIG) welding rod. They have planned and completed a welding project demonstrating the skills learned. The earner of this badge has the knowledge and understanding of the workplace safety and personal protective equipment requirements in this environment. Earners of this badge have undertaken this training as a pre-accredited course.
15ecb4a3-635a-408c-9a4d-6a7039853698.name: Introduction to Welding - Pre-accredited

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete a 35 hour course where they learn common welding techniques using metal and gas metal arc welding rods.  The skills and knowledge learned and practiced are demonstrated by planning and completing their own welding project by the completion of the course. Participants have also completed theoretical and onsite training to ensure the safe use of equipment and the requirements of a safe workplace environment.

skills.name: Able To Perform Basic Welding And Gas Cutting
Arc Welding Of Steel And Iron

eacc9b70-6a4d-4105-93a8-32a4d6dace6b.description: The earner of this badge has a fundamental understanding of how to safely operate maintain quadbike and side by side vehicles safely. Learners will have gained an understanding of the importance of safety and the risks associated with quad bike and side by side operation. The earner will gain entry level skills on how to safely ride a quad bike and side by side in different types of terrain. Earners of this badge have undertaken this training as a pre-accredited course.
eacc9b70-6a4d-4105-93a8-32a4d6dace6b.name: Quad bike & Side by Side - Pre-accredited

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully demonstrate to the assessor that they can safely prepare, ride and shut down the quad bike and side by side. The assessor will determine if the student has successfully completed this assessment off their skills and knowledge.

skills.name: Able to Conduct Pre-start Checks on both Quad Bikes and Side by Side
Safely Shut Down And Store Quad Bike
Safely Shut Down And Store Side-by-Side

25d23264-a551-48b6-86bb-a8de2471c147.description: The earner of this badge has the necessary demonstrated skills and knowledge under the Victorian Livestock Loading Scheme (VLLS) to facilitate the safe and efficient transportation of livestock by reducing the chances of animals being injured, increasing the productivity of livestock transport, protecting road and bridge infrastructure and reducing the changes of vehicles rolling over.
25d23264-a551-48b6-86bb-a8de2471c147.name: Victorian Livestock Loading Scheme (VLLS)

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: Attended one full day of face to face virtual training.
Observed by the employer as being competent in livestock transport for a minimum of 6 months.
Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of Victorian Livestock Loading Scheme safe and efficient transport of livestock
Demonstrated understanding of Australian Animal Welfare Standards and Guidelines Land Transport of Livestock, animals fit to load and bio-security requirements of Livestock Production Assurance
Demonstrated understanding of enhanced road safety, vehicle mass limits, planning of routes, calcuation of loads and driver safety responsibility
Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of VicRoad Roll Over Protection Program, VicRoads website and B-Double Network Maps and VicRoads Height Clearance on Roads

a9e010b2-0a8c-49ec-98be-10d8b6bf8dca.description: The earner of this badge has successfully gained the Nationally Accredited Certificate II in Shearing AHC21316. They have developed their skills, knowledge and understanding to shear sheep to a high standard, increasing in quality and speed. Have gained the skills to work in a shearing shed across the country. Rural Industries Skill Training (RIST) RTO: TOID 4198
a9e010b2-0a8c-49ec-98be-10d8b6bf8dca.name: Certificate II in Shearing AHC21316

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

alignments.name: AHC21316 Certificate II in Shearing
alignments.description: Qualification details for AHC21316 Certificate II in Shearing, listing all Units of Competency available under this qualification.

badge_template_activities.title: Understand their obligations to comply with relevant legislation and codes, work place procedures, application of environmentally sustainability work practices and animal welfare.
Ability to crutch and shear to an industry standard.
Capable of grinding combs and cutters for machine shearing, so they are effective for the type of wool and shearing conditions.

d096d2e1-c0e5-4120-a36a-10ffe195161b.description: The earner of this badge has a fundamental understanding of how to safely operate and maintain a chainsaw. Learners have gained an understanding of the importance of safety and preventing risks with Chainsaw operation. The earner has participated in basic branch and limb trimming, sharpening and cleaning of a chainsaw. Earners will also obtain a sense of independence and confidence when using a chainsaw. Earners of this badge have undertaken this training as a non-accredited course.
d096d2e1-c0e5-4120-a36a-10ffe195161b.name: Operate and Maintain Chainsaws - Non-accredited

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully demonstrate to the assessor that they can safely prepare, operate and maintain a chainsaw. The assessor will determine if the student has successfully completed this assessment from observation of their skills and successful completion of knowledge questions.

skills.name: Safely Prepare a Chainsaw for us

c4b3e43e-603d-4324-8b6c-58b0feb0173d.description: The earner of this badge has learnt and demonstrated the basic fundamental skills and techniques in operating and using a manual metal arc and gas metal arc (MIG) welding rod. They have planned and completed a welding project demonstrating the skills learned. The earner of this badge has the knowledge and understanding of the workplace safety and personal protective equipment requirements in this environment. Earners of this badge have undertaken this training as a non-accredited course.

The skills and knowledge learned and practiced are demonstrated by planning and completing their own welding project by the completion of the course. Participants have also completed theoretical and onsite training to ensure the safe use of equipment and the requirements of a safe workplace environment.

Arc Welding Of Steel And Iron

Learners have gained an understanding of the importance of safety and preventing risks with Chainsaw operation. The earner has participated in basic branch and limb trimming, sharpening and cleaning of a chainsaw. Earners will also obtain a sense of independence and confidence when using a chainsaw. skills.name: Safely Prepare a Chainsaw for us

1a7b5962-bb2a-45e7-83db-1f02a594199a.description: The earner of this badge has successfully gained the Nationally Accredited Certificate III in Shearing AHC32916. They have developed their skills, knowledge and understanding to shear sheep to a higher standard, increasing in quality and speed. Improving understanding of technique for shearing. Gained the skills to work in a shearing shed across the country. Rural Industries Skill Training (RIST) RTO: TOID 4198
1a7b5962-bb2a-45e7-83db-1f02a594199a.name: Certificate III in Shearing AHC32916

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

alignments.name: AHC32916 Certificate III in Shearing
alignments.description: Qualification details for AHC32916 Certificate III in Shearing, listing all Units of Competency available under this qualification.

badge_template_activities.title: Understand their obligations to comply with relevant legislation and codes, work place procedures, application of environmentally sustainability work practices and animal welfare.

Ability to crutch and shear to a higher industry standard, compared to the Certificate II in Shearing. Developed skills and knowledge required to select, handle and shear sheep to a professional level.
Capable of grinding combs and cutters for machine shearing, so they are effective for the type of wool and shearing conditions.
Dressing combs for machine shearing and how to maintain their equipment for optimal performance.

0f58b534-c66e-413c-9f41-f1b962ce0383.description: The earner of this badge has a fundamental understanding of how to safely operate a tractor and front end loader attachments. Earners complete pre-start checks, carry out routine maintenance & shut down procedures for tractor operation. Earners identify how to minimise hazards & risks in tractor operation. Earners of this badge have gained practical experience with operating the tractor and front end loader. Earners of this badge have undertaken this training as a pre-accredited course.
0f58b534-c66e-413c-9f41-f1b962ce0383.name: Tractor and Front End Loader Operation - Pre-accredited

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully demonstrate to the assessor that they can safely complete a pre-start check list, safely operate a tractor and front end loader, complete routine maintenance & carry out shut down procedures. The assessor will determine if the student has successfully completed this assessment from observation of their skills and successful completion of knowledge questions.

skills.name: Able to Conduct a Front End Loader Pre-start Check
Able to Conduct a Tractor Pre-start Check
Safely operate a Tractor and Front End Loader

737cbe4a-1ec4-4074-893f-055a24ff1277.description: The earner of this badge has learnt and demonstrated foundation entrepreneurial skills and concepts. The earner has designed a business idea and developed a website and short advertisement to promote the concept. The earner is able to understand the importance of customer feedback and empathetic product design. The earner of this badge has participated in a practical activity where they understand the values of teamwork, work health safety and problem solving.
737cbe4a-1ec4-4074-893f-055a24ff1277.name: Agribusiness Entrepreneurship

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete a semester course where they learn ideation, how to meet customer needs, minimal viable products and types of business including social enterprise. The skills and knowledge learned and practiced are demonstrated by developing a business idea, creating an advertisement, a website and producing a physical hands on project.

f4e7bef1-75c7-4586-98aa-a3b896723a11.description: The earner of this badge has a fundamental understanding of how to safely operate maintain quadbike and side by side vehicles safely. Learners will have gained an understanding of the importance of safety and the risks associated with quad bike and side by side operation. The earner will gain entry level skills on how to safely ride a quad bike and side by side in different types of terrain. Earners of this badge have undertaken this training as a non-accredited course.

issuer.summary: issued by Rural Industries Skill Training

skills.name: Able to Conduct Pre-start Checks on both Quad Bikes and Side by Side
Safely Shut Down And Store Quad Bike
Safely Shut Down And Store Side-by-Side
